events.title: Kanye Omari West is born
events.shortDescription: Kanye is born in Atlanta, Georgia
events.longDescription: Kanye Omari West is born in Atlanta, Georgia, to Ray West and Donda West. He is the eldest of their three children.

events.title: Relocation to Chicago
events.longDescription: Kanye West's family relocates to Chicago, Illinois. This city will have a profound impact on his future music and artistic style.

events.title: Early Interest in Music
events.longDescription: Kanye West shows an early interest in music and begins making beats and rapping. He attends Polaris High School and later transfers to Oak Lawn Community High School.

events.title: Music Production Career Begins
events.shortDescription: West starts creating beats for local artists
events.longDescription: Kanye West begins his music production career by creating beats for local artists in Chicago.

events.title: Scholarship and Music Pursuit
events.shortDescription: West receives a scholarship and drops out
events.longDescription: Kanye West receives a scholarship to attend the American Academy of Art in Chicago but drops out after one semester to pursue music full-time.

events.title: Recognition as a Producer
events.shortDescription: West gains recognition in the music industry
events.longDescription: Kanye West starts gaining recognition in the music industry as a producer, working with artists such as Jay-Z, Alicia Keys, and Janet Jackson. He produces several tracks on Jay-Z's album 'The Blueprint'.

events.title: The College Dropout
events.longDescription: The College Dropout is the debut studio album by Kanye West, released in 2004. It received critical acclaim for its innovative production, introspective lyrics, and unique blend of hip-hop and soul.

events.title: Late Registration
events.longDescription: Late Registration is Kanye West's second studio album, released in 2005. It features collaborations with artists like Jamie Foxx, Common, and Adam Levine.

events.title: Graduation
events.longDescription: Graduation is Kanye West's third studio album, released in 2007. It features the hit singles 'Stronger' and 'Good Life' and explores themes of personal growth and ambition.

events.title: MTV Video Music Awards Incident
events.longDescription: During the MTV Video Music Awards, Kanye West interrupts Taylor Swift's acceptance speech, sparking controversy and public backlash. The incident leads to a significant backlash against West, though he later apologizes for his actions.

events.title: My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy
events.longDescription: My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy is Kanye West's fifth studio album, released in 2010. It receives widespread acclaim and is often regarded as one of the greatest albums of all time.

events.title: Watch the Throne
events.longDescription: Watch the Throne is a collaborative album by Kanye West and Jay-Z, released in 2011. The album receives positive reviews and achieves commercial success.

events.title: Yeezus
events.longDescription: Yeezus is Kanye West's sixth studio album, released in 2013. It takes a more experimental and abrasive musical direction, and despite mixed initial reactions, the album is considered a significant artistic achievement.

events.title: Marriage to Kim Kardashian
events.longDescription: Kanye West marries reality TV star Kim Kardashian in a high-profile wedding ceremony.

events.title: The Life of Pablo
events.longDescription: The Life of Pablo is Kanye West's seventh studio album, released in 2016 exclusively on the streaming platform Tidal. The album receives mixed reviews but is a commercial success.

events.title: Ye
events.longDescription: Ye is Kanye West's eighth studio album, released in 2018. The album features a more introspective and personal tone, addressing his mental health struggles and controversial public image.

events.title: Sunday Service
events.longDescription: Kanye West starts his Sunday Service events, a series of gospel-inspired musical performances featuring a choir and gospel arrangements of his songs. These events gain attention and become a cultural phenomenon.

events.title: Presidential Campaign
events.longDescription: Kanye West announces his candidacy for President of the United States, running as an independent candidate under the 'Birthday Party' banner. However, his campaign is largely symbolic and does not gain significant traction.

events.title: Donda
events.longDescription: Donda is Kanye West's tenth studio album, named after his late mother. The album receives positive reviews and debuts at the top of the charts.

events.title: Yeezy Gap Collaboration
events.longDescription: Kanye West announces a collaboration with fashion brand Gap, launching the 'Yeezy Gap' line.

events.title: Ongoing Influence
events.shortDescription: Continued impact in music and fashion
events.longDescription: As of the current date, Kanye West continues to be an influential figure in music, fashion, and popular culture. His artistic ventures, personal life, and public statements continue to draw attention and spark discussions.
